required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Fluoride in a Dentifrice on Remineralization of Erosive Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Fluoride in an Experimental Dentifrice on Remineralization of Erosive Lesions In-Situ

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed study will evaluate the performance of fluoride delivered from a new dentifrice formulation without potassium nitrate. It will also evaluate the dose-response to fluoride by testing four dentifrices covering a range of sodium fluoride concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Surface Microhardness Recovery (%SMHR) Dose Response Relationship
primary_outcome.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first erosive challenge (E1) using formula: [(E1-R)/ (E1-B)]*100.

secondary_outcome.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first erosive challenge (E1) using formula: [(E1-R)/ (E1-B)]*100.

Changes in mineral content of enamel specimens exposed to dietary erosive challenge were determined by measuring the length of the indentations. Decrease in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates hardening of enamel surface. Enamel specimens were exposed to second erosion challenge to determine relative erosion resistance which compared the indentations values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), first erosive (E1) and second erosive challenge (E2). Percent relative erosion resistance was calculated by formula: [(E1-E2)/ (E1-B)]*100.

Enamel fluoride uptake was determined using the microdrill enamel biopsy technique. The amount of fluoride uptake by enamel was calculated based on amount of fluoride divided by area of the enamel cores. Data analysis was based on corrected data.

arm_group.description: Low ppm fluoride as sodium fluoride in a silica base dentifrice
Medium ppm fluoride as sodium fluoride in a silica base dentifrice
High ppm fluoride as sodium fluoride in a silica base dentifrice
no added fluoride in a silica base dentifrice

intervention.intervention_name: no added fluoride in a silica base

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- intact maxillary dental arch suitable to retain a palatal appliance, an intact mandibular dental arch and a stimulated/unstimulated saliva flow rate of ≥ 0.8 milliliter/minute (ml/min) and ≥ 0.2 ml/min respectively.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 72 participants were screened, and 62 were randomized into the study. 9 participants did not meet the study criteria and 1 withdrew consent. A washout non-fluoridated toothpaste was used for 2 days prior treatment. In-situ appliances were prepared for participants to fit enamel specimens.

group.title: Sodium Fluoride (NaF) Dentifrice,1426 Parts Per Million(Ppm)F
group.description: Participants were fitted with enamel specimen appliance in the palatal surface 5 minutes before treatment initiation. Participants brushed their teeth for one timed minute with 1.5 grams (g) ± 0.1g of NaF toothpaste (1426 ppmF) and expectorated. The direct contact between palatal appliance and toothbrush was avoided.

group.title: NaF Dentifrice (1150ppmF)
group.description: Participants were fitted with enamel specimen appliance in the palatal surface 5 minutes before treatment initiation. Participants brushed their teeth for one timed minute with 1.5 g ± 0.1g of NaF toothpaste (1150 ppmF) and expectorated. The direct contact between palatal appliance and toothbrush was avoided.

group.title: NaF Dentifrice (250ppmF)
group.description: Participants were fitted with enamel specimen appliance in the palatal surface 5 minutes before treatment initiation. Participants brushed their teeth for one timed minute with 1.5 g ± 0.1g of NaF toothpaste (250 ppmF) and expectorated. The direct contact between palatal appliance and toothbrush was avoided.

group.title: Placebo Dentifrice (0ppmF)
group.description: Participants were fitted with enamel specimen appliance in the palatal surface 5 minutes before treatment initiation. Participants brushed their teeth for one timed minute with 1.5 g ± 0.1g of placebo toothpaste (0 ppmF) and expectorated. The direct contact between palatal appliance and toothbrush was avoided.

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study treatments.

outcome.title: Percentage Surface Microhardness Recovery (%SMHR) Dose Response Relationship
outcome.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first erosive challenge (E1) using formula: [(E1-R)/ (E1-B)]*100.
outcome.population: Per protocol population: All randomized participants who received at least one study product, had one efficacy assessment and did not have any protocol violations deemed to affect efficacy. Missing values were not imputed.

SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. measure.population: Per protocol population: All randomized participants who received at least one study product, had one efficacy assessment and did not have any protocol violations deemed to affect efficacy. Missing values were not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: Test for linear dose-response relationship was performed for %SMHR as a function of fluoride concentration.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusted Mean and SE were calculated from ANOVA model with treatment and period as factors, and subject as a random factor.

analysis.groups_desc: Test for quadratic dose-response relationship was performed for %SMHR as a function of fluoride concentration.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusted Mean and SE were calculated from ANOVA model with treatment and period as factors, and subject as a random factor.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered treatments in comparison to be equal.
analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment was required for multiple comparisons as the primary comparison was pre-specified.
analysis.method_desc: ANOVA with fixed factors for study period and treatment and the subject as random effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a positive difference favors the first named treatment.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered no dose-response relationship between %SMHR and fluoride concentration in the dentifrice.
analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment was required for multiple comparisons as the primary comparison was pre-specified.
analysis.method_desc: ANOVA with fixed factors for study period and treatment and the subject as random effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a positive difference favors the first named treatment.

outcome.description: Changes in mineral content of enamel specimens exposed to dietary erosive challenge were determined by measuring the length of the indentations. Enamel specimens were exposed to second erosion challenge to determine relative erosion resistance which compared the indentations values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), first erosive (E1) and second erosive challenge (E2). Percent relative erosion resistance was calculated by formula: [(E1-E2)/ (E1-B)]*100.

outcome.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (Corrected Data)
outcome.description: Enamel fluoride uptake was determined using the microdrill enamel biopsy technique. The amount of fluoride uptake by enamel was calculated based on amount of fluoride divided by area of the enamel cores. Data analysis was based on corrected data.
outcome.population: PP population: All randomized participants who received at least one study product, had one efficacy assessment and did not have any protocol violations deemed to affect efficacy. Missing values were not imputed. Data analysis for this outcome measure was performed based on a correction factor.

group.title: NaF Dentifrice (1426 ppmF)
group.description: Participants were fitted with enamel specimen appliance in the palatal surface 5 minutes before treatment initiation. Participants brushed their teeth for one timed minute with 1.5 g ± 0.1g of NaF toothpaste (1426 ppmF) and expectorated. The direct contact between palatal appliance and toothbrush was avoided.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events encountered or spontaneously reported following administration of any investigational product (including washout product), or for up to 5 days after the last administration of investigational product were recorded.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
